p: Kim et al. [ 51] assessed the insecticide activity and the inhibiting effect exerted on Sitophilus oryzae of acetylcholinesterase (AChE) from essential oils and compounds extracted from 10 species of plants of the family of Apiaceae. Among the plants included in the study, the essential oils obtained from Anethum graveolens, Carum carvi and Cuminum cyminum showed a strong fumigant toxicity against S. oryzae. The plants that were concerned also included Carum carvi. Among the compounds, (+)-carvone, (−)-carvone, cuminaldehyde, dihydrocarvone, linalool oxide, carveol, trans-anethole and neral also displayed higher toxicities against S. oryzae as fumigants. The strongest inhibitions towards acetylocholinoesterase were displayed by α-pinen, followed by β-pinen and limonene.
